intro: Epicranthes psilorhopalon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and slightly serrated, with a hairy texture. Native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. This species is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a hardy and resilient plant.
